question_text: Joel had supplies.\nSubtract using the fraction strips.\n$\frac{9}{11}$ - $\frac{6}{11}$ = \_
solution: Look at the fraction strips. 9 $\frac{1}{11}$ fraction strips are shaded. They represent $\frac{9}{11}$. 6 $\frac{1}{11}$ fraction strips have been taken away. This shows subtracting $\frac{6}{11}$.

To find the difference, look at how many $\frac{1}{11}$ fraction strips are left. There are 3 $\frac{1}{11}$ fraction strips left after 6 $\frac{1}{11}$ strips are taken away. So, the difference is $\frac{3}{11}$.\nNotice that, $\frac{9}{11}$ - $\frac{6}{11}$ = $\frac{3}{11}$.
backend_description: $\frac{9}{11}$ is represented by 9 filled boxes out of 11 boxes. Subtracting $\frac{6}{11}$ is represented by crossing out 6 of the 9 filled boxes.\nQuestion: What is $\frac{9}{11}$ - $\frac{6}{11}$.\nAnswer: $\frac{3}{11}$

To find the difference, look at how many $\frac{1}{7}$ fraction strips are left. There are 2 $\frac{1}{7}$ fraction strips left after 3 $\frac{1}{7}$ strips are taken away. So, the difference is $\frac{2}{7}$.\nNotice that, $\frac{5}{7}$ - $\frac{3}{7}$ = $\frac{2}{7}$.
backend_description: $\frac{5}{7}$ is represented by 5 filled boxes out of 7 boxes. Subtracting $\frac{3}{7}$ is represented by crossing out 3 of the 5 filled boxes.\nQuestion: What is $\frac{5}{7}$ - $\frac{3}{7}$.\nAnswer: $\frac{2}{7}$
